texts.value: cGMP-activated cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase with a dual-specificity for the second messengers cAMP and cGMP, which are key regulators of many important physiological processes (PubMed:1654333, PubMed:6276403). Has a higher efficiency with cGMP compared to cAMP (By similarity). Plays a role in cell growth and migration (By similarity)

Regulates mitochondrial cAMP levels and respiration. Involved in the regulation of mitochondria morphology/dynamics and apoptotic cell death via local modulation of cAMP/PKA signaling in the mitochondrion, including the monitoring of local cAMP levels at the outer mitochondrial membrane and of PKA-dependent phosphorylation of DNM1L

reaction.name: a nucleoside 3',5'-cyclic phosphate + H2O = a nucleoside 5'-phosphate + H(+)

texts.value: Binds 2 divalent metal cations per subunit. Site 1 may preferentially bind zinc ions.
Binds 2 divalent metal cations per subunit. Site 2 has a preference for magnesium ions.
The 3',5'-cyclic-AMP phosphodiesterase activity is stimulated by 3',5'-cyclic GMP
The GAF 1 domain functions as a dimerization domain
The GAF 2 domains binds cGMP, which acts as an allosteric activator
Belongs to the cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase family. PDE2 subfamily

citation.title: Molecular cloning of a cyclic GMP-stimulated cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase cDNA. Identification and distribution of isozyme variants.
Amino acid sequence of the cyclic GMP stimulated cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase from bovine heart.
Identification of a conserved domain among cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterases from diverse species.
Purification and characterization of a cyclic GMP-stimulated cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase from bovine tissues.

properties.value: P:cellular response to granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor stimulus
P:cellular response to macrophage colony-stimulating factor stimulus
P:negative regulation of adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway
P:negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
